observation: Mathcad - The software for engineering calculations - Alfasoft  Skip to content English UK Select Danish Products Scientific Writing References and Citations EndNote Citavi Equations, Formulas and Graphs MathType ChemDraw Publishing PDF and OCR FineReader PDF Technical Documentation Mathcad Data Analysis QDA (Qualitative Data Analysis) NVivo NVivo Transcription NVivo Collaboration ATLAS.ti Design and Engineering Math and Calculations Altair Compose Simulation and System Modelling Altair SimLab Altair Activate Altair Inspire Altair Embed Chemistry and Laboratory Chemistry Spectroscopy GRAMS/AI Development Tools High-Performance Computing Mobile and Embedded Programming Test Management Database Tools Support Training News Alfasoft Search for... Navigation Menu Mathcad Prime 9 Mathcad is the industry-standard software for engineering calculations BUY MATHCAD GET QUOTE FREE TRIAL Mathcad is chosen by most companies in the market for top-quality calculations to verify and validate engineering design calculations. This software tool, synonymous with professional yet easy-to-follow technical documentation, is a world-leading calculation software. Alfasoft can provide licences, technical support, administration, and tailor-made training for all your calculation and Mathcad needs. Mathcad is the choice of engineering companies when they are looking for their engineers to work efficiently and error-free by using a tool that: is easy-to-use supports automated and quick calculations verifies calculation results Mathcad has helped our business by enabling standard calculations to be derived and developed for the whole team. This has improved our accuracy and document quality and provides a conventional math notation for all. . Continue Reading - Subscribe to our Newsletters Copyright © 2024 Alfasoft Contact us Work with us Cookie & Privacy Policy Terms & Conditions

thought: The search results show reviews for a company called "Alfasoft" on Trustpilot and Glassdoor. However, the reviews on Trustpilot refer to "Alfasoft Ai," which seems to be a different entity than "Alfasoft" that deals with software for engineering calculations. Meanwhile, Glassdoor reviews suggest that Alfasoft is a legitimate company with actual employees and business practices. These reviews do not indicate fraudulent activity, but I should check if the reviews are for the same company as the website in question.

The DNS record retrieval for alfasoft.com seems to have encountered an issue with the status "NXDOMAIN," which indicates that the domain does not exist in the DNS records. This is a potential red flag, as it contradicts the WHOIS data that showed the domain as registered and updated. There may be a technical issue or discrepancy that needs to be resolved, or it could indicate that something is amiss. I will take one more action to try to clarify this discrepancy.

There are no certificate details retrieved for alfasoft.com, which is unusual because most legitimate business websites have SSL certificates that can be retrieved and verified. This absence of certificate information, combined with the DNS discrepancy, raises concerns about the legitimacy of the website. However, the other evidence I've gathered so far does not conclusively point to fraud. To make a final determination, I should review all observations and see if they align with the characteristics of a fraudulent website. Based on all the actions taken and observations made, I now know the final answer. After considering all the evidence, there are some discrepancies and missing information (such as the DNS issue and lack of SSL certificate data), but overall, the website does not exhibit the typical characteristics of a fraudulent site as described in the initial brief. The site does not offer unusually low prices or free claims, the company information appears to be legitimate based on WHOIS data and online reviews, and the content of the site is consistent with that of a professional software provider. Therefore, I conclude that the website https://alfasoft.com/uk/software/design-and-engineering/math-and-calculations/mathcad/ is not a fraudulent site.

observation.reason: The website does not exhibit the typical characteristics of a fraudulent site. It has a longstanding domain presence professional content and positive online reviews. Despite some missing SSL certificate data and a DNS query discrepancy there is not enough evidence to classify it as a fraudulent site.
